summary: Ministers refused blanket refund to families who had to pay extra to get documents . Just 2,191 compensation applications were approved between April last year and January this year , scarcely changed from 2,077 for the previous year . Home Affairs Committee chairman Keith Vaz led the calls for compensation .
aspect: 1. Holidaymakers affected by last summer's passport delay did not receive compensation. 2. Passport agency made £42 million profit while staff received up to £3,500 in bonuses. 3. Ministers denied blanket refunds, stating it would create a precedent.
explain: Holidaymakers affected by last summer's passport delay did not receive compensation, despite the profitable £42 million surplus of the passport agency. Ministers denied blanket refunds, stating it would create a precedent.
answer: Yes, the context is present in the summary.
